page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CUDDY BROW -} Steep slope - presumably where there was a donkey. {HIGH CLOSE -}High enclosed field. {WILLYBUSS LONNING. -}Willow bush lane. {BLACK MOSS -}Peat moss where the settlement dug for fuel.{MOSS SIDE - House beside the moss.{MIRESIDE - House beside the swampy ground.{INTAK - Piece of ground taken in or enclosed.{THE WATH -}Ford over the beck(Brook).{HAUSE/HALLS -}Narrow entrance to a valley.{HIGH SIDE-}The high part of the Parish.{LOW SIDE- The low part of the Parish.{DODD -}a bare hill.{CALVA -}Hill where calves were pastured.{PINFOLD -}Public pound where stray beasts were kept. {DYKE {NOOK -}Ditch with an embankment in a small field or farm stead. .
